data.title: Brilliant!
data.text: I've been to many tourist information offices over the years, and always appreciate the helpful people who populate them. But this was exceptional. The young lady in the office provided us with helpful information, with maps, on a wide range of subjects, in a truly expert way. Born locally, but travelled, she understood exactly what we needed, including some things we didn't know we needed, and gave us helpful, clear, honest and rich information about it all. This was as good as tourist information gets, and we were really pleased that we went in fir help.

data.title: Excellent information, displays and MUST to start your day
data.text: I have been to Lancaster many times before and never took the time to visit Old Downtown Lancaster until this trip. I wish I had before because I didn't realize all that it has to offer. I don't have the time to truly explore the area but I did stop in the visitor center and was pleasantly surprised to see that it offered various literature on the area. Take the time to sit and watch the moving/talking display. It will give you some insights on the area.

data.title: Helpful advice
data.text: Good maps and advice.  They had some interesting Lancaster trinkets for sale, too.  Clean restroom available for use, too.

data.title: Great Place to Start Your Trip
data.text: A well managed and stocked information center in the center of Lancaster.  Knowledgeable staff offering useful information and suggestions for Lancaster as well as the surrounding Pennsylvania Dutch/Amish countryside.  All the usual publications with all the usual information.  And a very interesting video display with historical figures from the area chatting with each other about the history of the area - entertaining, informative and well done

data.title: A good first stop
data.text: A good first stop -- The staff is knowledgeable and VERY helpful. I cant imagine how many people each day ask the same questions. But they made us feel as if we were the first who wanted to know where the best drives were to see the Plain Folks' farm.... etc. As we headed out on the walking tour, it started to rain. Since my rain jacket was back at the hotel, the staff on duty gave me a plastic garbage bag to make into a raincoat! So considerate.

data.title: Very helpful
data.text: A charming lady helped us with information for our visit.  I was traveling with my 12 year old granddaughter and she was selecting our places to visit.  The lady was so lovely with her as she shared the points of interest.  We were very glad we stopped.

data.title: Engaging, very knowledgeable guide
data.text: Since we were in the area, we decided to try the AAA-recommended Lancaster City tour. Although the area street was under construction, our guide made the best of it. It was a warm day, so he tried hard to keep us in the shade. He knew ALL the fun info on the area.

data.title: Super tour!!!!
data.text: What an excellent tour of Lancaster and our guide was very knowledgeable about the history of the area.

data.title: The staff was very helpful
data.text: We had a really nice lady who helped us.  I'm afraid I didn't get her name.  But we took several of her recommendations and were not disappointed.

data.title: Historic walking tour
data.text: Our volunteer, Tom, was full of great historical information! $8 for a 2 hour walking tour was well worth it! The visitor center is welcoming, and the ladies staffed there are very friendly. Take the tour during one of the days that the Central Market is open. They are directly next to each other.

data.title: Polite, friendly and informative
data.text: By phone and in person, the workers at this location were polite, friendly and helpful. They also had good phamplets

data.title: Be sure to visit!
data.text: The downtown visitors center is a must see for all travelers.  Most come for the Amish but downtown Lancaster has a wealth of experiences to offer.  Being the oldest town in the US not on a coast give downtown a rich and wide history.  Start your trip by starting here or perhaps its Sister center on Greenfield Road.

data.title: Provide very good information on local area
data.text: Make sure you stop buy here for free information on activities in local area. I found it to be very helpful in selecting which local area of interest to visit.

data.title: Christmas Vacation
data.text: The Visitor Center was staffed by friendly and helpful employees who offered many useful suggestions. They made us aware of the Farmers' Market right next store which was a trip highlight.

data.title: Good info, wonderful staff
data.text: My son and I arrived at the Visitor Center at closing time as we didn't have their operating times with us. There was only one person left in the building and about to leave but she decided to let us in so we could pick up some brochures. We quickly chose them and this very charming lady went out of her way to give us information about the different places of interest and gave us some other brochures that were very helpful. We were delighted with her approach and grateful for taking the time to help us. It's a nice old building by the way, and there's a beautiful indoor market right around the corner.

data.title: Right in the middle of downtown
data.text: Can't miss the place, it's right off the circle in downtown. Nice little old building with a couple of ladies that couldn't have been funnier. They knew what they were talking about, have great ideas for places to visit and great at directions. Don't miss this place...

data.title: very helpful
data.text: The visitor center is in a remodeled historical building.  It sits on the main square and is adjacent to the Farmer's Market -- making it a convenient stop.  The people working at the center were friendly and helpful.

data.title: Amazing talking portraits!
data.text: My husband loved this place! It has a motion activated talking portrait room. Once activated the portraits engage in a conversation with each other. The conversations are educational yet humorously entertaining. The portraits come alive! Put it on your must see list!

data.title: Frienldy staff and interesting film
data.text: The best place to start your visit to Lancaster. The staff is very helpful and maps of self guided walking tours are available. A film can get you started and guided tours also start here.

data.title: Not Open on a Saturday and Hard to Get To
data.text: Come one Lancaster.  It's Oct. 10 and a holiday weekend and your visitor's office isn't open on Sat. afternoon?!  Signage to this place was poor - tiny letters saying "Visitor's Center" on signs with about 6 other things on them.  We drove round and round and then found there was zero parking for an RV nearby.  Finally, found a parking space a few blocks away, walked there to discover it was closed before 4 pm!  Booo!  Thanks to the staff at the nearby Marriott for stepping in to cover Lancaster Visitor's Center's deficiency.

owner_response.author: Amber S, Public Relations Manager at Lancaster City Visitor Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Deidre, thank you for your feedback. We sincerely apologize that we were not able to accommodate you on Saturday during your visit to Lancaster City. We're grateful that our friends at the Marriott could assist with travel advice. Our Visitor Center has been open since July and we have found that the majority of guests do visit between the hours of 9 am and 4 pm, before they start their day. However we understand the need to extend hours on a holiday weekend and will consider that as we move forward. We wish we had been able to help you navigate the City over the phone - the best way to remember where we are located is where King & Queen Streets meet in the center of town. We hope you enjoyed the rest of your visit to Lancaster!
owner_response.title: Owner Response
